731181f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Decoration Day Parade.
731181f-a.text:
Celebrations, Parades and Municipal Events: A contingent of girls in the 1894 Decoration Day Parade. Buildings in the background are on the west side of Broadway, at 26th Street.
May 30, 1894.
The Illustrated American

717360f-b.text:
Broadway, south from 26th Street. Fifth Avenue is to the left and intersects this thoroughfare at 23rd Street. The apex formed at that point is occupied by the triangular Fuller (Flatiron) Building. To the left appears the low white structure that was the former Hotel Bartholdi: View 2 is photographed from 25th Street, being closer to the aforementioned features. The street clock is in front of the 5th Avenue Building.
June 15, 1937
Views 1,2
Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
Same view farther south.
dorks Progress Administration  June 15, 1937
Five Boroughs Project  View 3
